remarks: A domain has no zero-divisors (besides zero).  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2010.)
statement:
dmnnzd.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
dmnnzd.2 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
dmnnzd.3 $e |- X = ran G $.
dmnnzd.4 $e |- Z = ( GId ` G ) $.
dmnnzd $p |- ( ( R e. Dmn /\ ( A e. X /\ B e. X /\ ( A H B ) = Z ) ) -> ( A = Z \/ B = Z ) ) $.
